definition: everything clear and in good order (idiom); neat and tidy
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: I've been keeping my room as neat as a pin, and the yard is always ship-shape.
sentences.chinese: 我一直保持房間井然有序，院子也是修得井井有條的。

sentences.english: There are six households inhabiting in the building, compact and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 樓內住有六戶人家，家居緊湊，井然有序。

sentences.english: By just enjoying this, you ran your family and everything went along well?
sentences.chinese: 你只去享受這些就能把家裏一切事務管理得井然有序？

sentences.english: This is a butterfly-shaped crossroads. The vehicles driving towards all directions are in good order.
sentences.chinese: 這是一座蝶式立交橋，去往各個方向的車輛井然有序。

sentences.english: Orderliness is being neat and living with a sense of harmony.
sentences.chinese: 條理性就是井然有序，生活和諧。

sentences.english: It means in perfect order, very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 這個短語代表井然有序，條理分明。

sentences.english: The officers moved methodically toward the body, making sure they did not disturb the crime scene.
sentences.chinese: 警察們井然有序地走向屍體，確保案發現場不被破壞。

sentences.english: I stopped noticing India’s newness, oldness and juxtapositioned-ness.
sentences.chinese: 我不再留意印度的新鮮，古老以及井然有序。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor's rule is orderly and without caprice.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝的規則是井然有序，不會反覆無常的。

sentences.english: The troops retired in good order.

definition: everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
not one thread loose (idiom); strictly according to the rules/meticulous/not one hair out of place
